entry.title: EducationNewscast: Dein Lern, Change und Adoption Podcast auf Spotify verfügbar
entry.content:
Der EducationNewscast Podcast ist auf Spotify umgezogen. Demnächst kannst ihn weiterhin über alle wichtigen Podcast-Plattformen hören. Vor allem auf Apple Podcasts, das ja viele unser HörerInnen nutzen. Erfahre hier, wo du ihn jetzt findest.

Was mit dem EducationNewscast Podcast passiert ist

Vielleicht hast du gemerkt, dass die alte EducationNewscast-Seite auf openSAP nicht mehr erreichbar ist. Das war dieser Link: https://podcast.opensap.info/education-newscast/  Durch einen Sicherheitsvorfall musste das ursprüngliche Podcast-Backend dauerhaft abgeschaltet werden.

Damit Du weiterhin ohne Unterbrechung zuhören kannst, haben wir den Podcast auf eine neue, sichere Infrastruktur umgezogen. Hosting und RSS-Feeds laufen bis auf Weiteres über Spotify.

Direkt zum Podcast auf Spotify:
EducationNewscast Podcast auf Spotify

For english listeners: here is our EducationNewscast english only edition channel.

Dort findest du alle bisherigen Folgen – und alle neuen Episoden erscheinen über dieses Setup.

Übrigens: wir freuen uns immer über Sternchen und Bewertungen 😊. Das hilf immer bei der Sichtbarkeit im Universum der vielen Podcast.

Wo du den EducationNewscast jetzt hören kannst

Für dich im Alltag ändert sich wenig – du kannst einfach so weiterhören wie bisher:

  • Spotify – unsere neue Hauptplattform und Empfehlung: Folge dem Podcast dort
  • Apple Podcasts & weitere – kommt demnächst – das wird hier upgedated

Die frühere Übersichtsseite kann leider nicht zurückkehren. Wenn du alte Lesezeichen oder Links nutzt, ersetze sie bitte durch die Spotify-Showseite, damit du und dein Netzwerk immer direkt zum richtigen Ziel kommen.

Worum es in diesem Podcast über digitales Lernen, Change Management und KI geht

Im EducationNewscast dreht sich alles um digitales Lernen, künstliche Intelligenz und AI Adoption, Change Management, Corporate Learning und Future Skills im SAP-Umfeld.

Du bekommst:

  • Gespräche Expert:innen, Praktiker:innen und Innovator:innen
  • Einblicke in echte Erfahrungen aus Projekten
  • Einschätzungen, wie künstliche Intelligenz und Automatisierung Lernen und Transformation verändern
  • Impulse zu Trends

Wenn du im Learning & Development (L&D), in HR, in der Personalentwicklung, im Change Management, in der Beratung oder IT arbeitest – oder dich generell für diese Themen interessierst, ist dieser Podcast genau richtig für dich.

Warum Hörer:innen den EducationNewscast mögen

Aus Rückmeldungen und Bewertungen sehen wir, warum unsere Hörer:innen den Podcast schätzen:

  • Du bekommst praxisnahe Tipps, die du direkt in deinen eigenen Projekte anwenden kannst
  • Durch die breite Auswahl an Gästen bleibt jede Folge frisch und relevant – von inhaltlichen Verantwortlichen über Forscher:innen bis hin zu Technologie-Expert:innen
  • Komplexe Themen wie KI in der Wissensarbeit, AI Adoption oder Change Management werden klar und verständlich erklärt
  • Für viele ist er auch ein interessanter Blick über den Tellerrand der eigenen Organisation

So bleibst du mit dem Podcast auf dem Laufenden

Damit du keine neuen Folgen verpasst:

  1. Auf Spotify folgen
    Öffne die EducationNewscast Podcast-Seite auf Spotify und klicke auf „Folgen".
  2. In deiner Podcast-App abonnieren (kommt demnächst)
    Suche nach „EducationNewscast", abonniere den Podcast und aktiviere Benachrichtigungen.
  3. Links aktualisieren und teilen
    Wenn du bisher die alte openSAP-Übersichtsseite verlinkt hast, tausche den Link bitte gegen die Spotify-URL aus und teile sie mit Kolleg:innen und deinem Netzwerk.

entry.title: Re: Service Contract Item List - custom fields
entry.content:
Good day @Sorosch_Sakhiza 

Thank you for your question.

Yes, it is possible in the public cloud.

The prerequisites are, you have to create the custom filed with a related business context Service Contract Item in Custom Fields and Logic. Then enable it for the service contract app under UIs and Reports. Thereafter, use Adapt UI in the service contract app to add that field as a visible column in the item list. If your business context is Service Contract header only and not item-level, it will not be available as a column in the item table.

Have a look at this reference for more details:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/adbae5bcd5994f159bf2847a11397b61/bfd98ae6ed9f4eb6b92436c7815dbf66.html?locale=en-US

Let me know if you have further questions.

 

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Focused Build's Solution Readiness Dashboard with SAC External Integration
entry.content:
Introduction 

In newest release of Focused Build SP16, the solution readiness dashboard has been enhanced to incorporate external tool integration-related fields within the requirements, work packages, and work items details pages. This integration helps users to track and report on the entities that were initially created or derived from external tools such as JIRA and then transferred to Focused Build. 

Background 

Previously, customers had no way to view or report on external tool integration (Mapping field -external Id) within any Focused Build reporting feature. This limitation resulted in an inability to report on all requirements, work packages, or work items that originated in an external tool and were subsequently transferred to Focused Build. 

Integration Enhancements 

To address these limitations, the field External Id has been made available for reporting in the following areas: 

Requirements 

  • Requirements Details  

External Tool fields in Requirement Details Page

 

 

Work Packages 

  • Work Packages Details  
  • Work Packages KPI Details  
  • Work Packages Distribution  

External Tool fields in Work package Details Page

 

 

Work Items 

  • Work Items Details  
  • Work Items KPI Details  
  • Work Items Distribution  

External Tool fields in Work Item Details Page

 

 Technical details for fetching and displaying the external fields 

Specifics for Requirements: 

For requirements, the reporting includes the combination of the following fields: 

  • CRM_ORDERADM_H-/SALM/EXT_ID: The external tool ID. 
  • System GUID (/SALM/C_EXI_MAPP-GUID_EXT): The globally unique identifier for the external system. 

These fields are necessary to correctly map the external system and the corresponding ID. 

Specifics for Work Packages and Work Items: 

For work packages (WPs) and work items (WIs), the reporting requirements are more specific: 

  • The combination of CRM_ORDERADM_H-/SALM/EXT_ID and External System Profile (/SALM/C_EXI_PRJ-EXI_PROFILE) must be included for reporting. 
  • This is only applicable when CRM_ORDERADM_H-/SALM/EXI_ACTIVE = 'X'—indicating that integration with the external tool is active. 

Benefits 

With these enhancements, customers now have the ability to: 

  • Track and report on the entities derived/created in external tools. 
  • Enhance reporting and visibility, ensuring that external tool integrations are accurately tracked and managed. 
  • Also, it is possible to extract the external tool related fields to an excel from respective detailed pages of solution readiness dashboard. 

Important Links and Resources: 

Focused Build for Solution Manager 
 
Agile Project Delivery with Focused Build for SAP Solution Manager 

ALM Community page

entry.title: SAP Fiori Innovation Day in Walldorf featured two hands-on sessions plus AI everywhere
entry.content:
SAP Fiori Innovation Day in Walldorf continued the momentum of the UX Foundation team showing the latest embedded AI features in My Home and the SAP Fiori elements framework. At our event on December 9, 2025, customers spent a day learning, developing, and networking with each other, SAP experts, and the sponsors.

Hands-on sessions showed how AI speeds application development

New for this iteration of SAP Fiori Innovation Day, we added an additional hands-on session beyond our usual one where people develop an SAP Fiori elements app using building blocks. The new one allowed people to try agentic app development with common AI clients and SAP’s MCP servers. This is a great way to save time creating SAP Fiori apps and an approach we are starting to use at SAP.

We also discussed the quality of AI-created code. Even if AI generates something faster than you could on your own, it is mandatory for you to understand the code so you can check it in with confidence and explain (or defend) anything during a code review. One of our architects explained that “I don’t know; the AI wrote this part” is not an acceptable answer. His main message was: “as a developer, you own the code.”

Graphic of the schedule for SAP Fiori Innovation Day in Walldorf

SAP Fiori continues to evolve to make SAP Cloud ERP easier to use

The day started with an overview of SAP Fiori and what this looks like in SAP S/4HANA Cloud. It included a discussion of the SAP Design System and how that includes common themes for UX consistency and enterprise product standards such as accessibility to help both designers and developers create applications that end users love.

Graphic showing overall strategy for SAP’s products

Demos illustrated and reinforced the points made in the slides. Similar to how you would begin your day with SAP Cloud ERP, we started with My Home and all the different ways you have to launch apps and make the page your own. The intro session also covered adjacent UX topics such as SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Start, and SAP’s mobile apps as well as a discussion of Joule and how it adds value across SAP’s portfolio.

Graphic showing Joule interaction patterns.

SAP Fiori includes more AI capabilities for business users

The afternoon demos were split into generally available and beta functionality in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. The released functionality included:

My Home

  • Card creation in My Home– creates cards that display essential business data that you can add to My Home
  • Joule-assisted insight card creation in My Home– ask Joule for the information you need and create a card that you can add to My Home
  • Recap – shows changes to tasks, cards, and app since you last accessed the system, making it easy to see what you missed when you were away

The recap feature in My Home shows you what changed in the system since your last access.

SAP Fiori elements apps

  • Easy filter – natural language searching in SAP Fiori elements list reports
  • Smart summarization – AI-created summary of SAP Fiori elements object pages
  • Error explanation – AI-assisted content that explains the meaning of error and provides suggestions on how to clear the error condition

Later in our “the future (one more thing)” session, we shared with some previews of planned AI functionality that will first be released into SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Editon.

  • Easy Fill – copies text from an email or other source into the relevant fields on an object page
  • AI-assisted task automation (development code name “Smart Helpers”) – allows business users to automate steps in one or more SAP Fiori apps to streamline a complex process

Easy fill is currently in beta testing with selected public cloud customers. AI-assisted task automation is still in development.

The partners shared different ways to build the future you want in your SAP environment

The gold sponsors for SAP Fiori Innovation Day, eXXcellent solutions, cbs, and sovanta,  presented on topics that engaged the audience as each focused on solving a specific problem common to SAP ERP customers.

  • eXXcellent talked about how to add AI capabilities to your SAP system, even if you are running SAP S/4HANA on-prem.
  • cbs covered how to decrypt SAP error messages with AI, BTP, and a little magic from a tool they have created called ADAM.
  • sovanta discussed how to prioritize what apps to develop, since the cost of building apps is dropping significantly due to AI.

Thanks to everyone who made SAP Fiori Innovation Day a success

  • SAP Presenters (in order of appearance): Thomas Reiss, Katrin Polloczek, Ioannis Grammatikakis, Yeganeh Hajimiri, Katya Bondarenko, Marcel Kassner, Christoph Gollmick.
  • Gold sponsors eXXcellent solutions, cbs, and sovanta
  • Silver sponsors: Uniorg and STELACON
  • Behind the scenes team: all the developers, architects, product managers and other colleagues who built the features we showed, tested the systems, wrote the documentation, packaged the demos, and created the hands-on exercises.
  • Our executive sponsors: Alex Lingg, Ioannis Grammatikakis, Sebastian Steinhauer, Katja Zoch
  • Special thanks to Sebastian Werner and Conny Kinateder for all the logistics work that made everything run smoothly for the customers and partners.

Thanks to all the participants for their enthusiasm and great, probing questions throughout the event. Your feedback on what we showed helps us prioritize our development going forward. The conversations in the hallway, at the coffee machine, and during meals give us a deeper sense of where you are in your SAP Fiori adoption and how we can best serve your interests.

Next steps

  • Register for the monthly SAP Fiori development roundtable call to meet other developers and architects who build SAP Fiori apps.
  • Subscribe to the SAP Fiori development newsletter, in which we share updates on SAP Fiori elements, SAP Fiori tools, SAPUI5, and SAP Build Code every other month.  
  • Join us at an SAP Fiori Development Innovation Day in 2026 – we are looking at locations, dates, and some new event formats.

On behalf of the SAP UX Foundation Team, Peter Spielvogel.

entry.title: How can we get the packing data of a material in a PPD
entry.content:
To determine how many SFC's can be packed in a packing unit we can configure packing data at the packing unit material. For example: a returnable packing material with an allowed Packaging SFC Quantity of 10. 

Now in a Production process design we want to automate the packing of SFC's and when the allowed packing SFC Quantity is exceeded the packing unit is closed and a new one is created for further packing. 

When using the get materials service in the PPD's its missing this packing data information in the response. 

How do we get this information?

entry.title: Re: Transferring Carryover To A Separate Time Account
entry.content:
Hi @danielgeorge ,

 

First of all thanks for your arcticle, it is very important to understand some behaviors of this tool.

I will explain my problem and maybe you can help me: I have currently an integration from SAP HCM to SuccessFactors EC about vacation quotas from all users, including the vacation requests. Now we will migrate the vacation requests to SuccessFactors on Time Off Management, and I need to integrate only the quota.

For Go-Live we need to close all Time Accounts from current users and set the remaining values Of Time Account Types to the new Time Account Type, and here I used your solution.

I could repoduce your configuration until close the current Time Account Type, set the remaining quota on custom field and create the Carryover Time Account Type, but for the second step to create Carryover from user and lookup custom field value I can't reproduce.

We I run the Time Off Calendar, this not get any employee.

Maybe it is because I create all time Types Account Types Ad-hoc, because I receive the quota from integration and not generating the accrual.

This is what I found on SAP Documentation "They also can't be created by using a Time Off calendar, because account creation calendars always create missing accounts for any users who have a certain time account type assigned."

So, does you know how can I adapt this second part to generate a new Time Account type and set the remaining quota from users?

 

Kind Regards,

JC

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition – “Small WM”: scope item, licensing, IM → WM switch
entry.content:
We are currently facing conflicting statements regarding warehouse management in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition and are looking for a clear clarification from the community.

Context

  • It is stated by some that a so-called “small Warehouse Management” is always included as standard in the Public Cloud.

  • Other statements indicate that a dedicated scope item and potentially additional licensing are required.

  • Our requirement is very limited and specific:
    We mainly need WM for organizational structure purposes, i.e. to create WM warehouses (warehouse numbers) – not for complex warehouse processes or decentralized EWM.

Specific questions

  1. Which exact scope item in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition represents this “small WM”?
    (Scope ID / official name in CBC)

  2. Is this scope always included in the standard Public Cloud license, or is it separately licensable?

  3. Does this scope allow real WM warehouses in the organizational structure, or is it effectively only Inventory Management with extended features?

  4. Is there any official SAP documentation or community statement that clearly confirms the scope and licensing situation?

  5. Future IM → WM scenario:

    • Are there known restrictions for serial-number–managed materials?

    • Are serial number profiles in IM and WM incompatible, making a later switch complex or risky?

entry.title: Re: Public Cloud Internal Supplier Integration with EDI
entry.content: For this, you can use the BADIs available within the custom logic app. Each BADI affects different points. For example, you can use the SD_SLS_MODIFY_ITEM_REQDATE BADI to modify the requested delivery date, or the EDI_SD_ORDER_MODIFY_HEADER BADI to change the header information in the sales order.

entry.title: Re: Service Contract Item List - custom fields
entry.content:
Hi @Sorosch_Sakhiza,

thanks for raising the question. 

According to SAP's current design, custom fields cannot be directly added as columns to the item overview table in the "Manage Service Contracts" app. The "Service Contract Item List" is not included in the personalization options for custom fields in the current application design.

To have custom fields available in the personalization options of the item overview table, you should Submit a feature request through the Customer Influence Portal.

Best regards,
Julius - SAP Cloud ERP Consulting

entry.title: Re: Service Contract Item List - custom fields
entry.content:
Hello @Chris1973,

I am afraid that the request functionality is not support. Yes, you can add custom fields at Service Contract Item level to the "Item Details" section in the Manage Service Contracts app, but these fields cannot be added to the item list view.

Best regards,
Julius - SAP Cloud ERP Consulting

entry.title: Specification Management in SAP Integrated Product Development – What’s AI got to do with it?
entry.content:
In today’s blog, I would like to let you know how SAP IPD is leveraging AI and seamless integration to transform the way organizations manage product specifications, collaborate with suppliers, and drive sustainability.

Furthermore, at the end of this blog, I am including the link to our latest Expert Talk, featuring SAP Product Expert Felix Reichle who talked about the latest insights from customers who are already using the latest advancements of SAP IPD in their daily operations.

So let’s get started!

The Power of Integration: SAP IPD Meets SAP Cloud ERP Private  

One of SAP’s core goals is to strengthen the integration across business processes, connecting ERP with both upstream and downstream applications. The integration of SAP IPD with SAP Cloud ERP delivers significant value for specification management:

  • Streamlined Collaboration: Internal product developers and external suppliers collaborate efficiently in dedicated spaces, accelerating both product development and procurement.
  • Advanced Collaboration Tools: Features like task assignment, notifications, and historical tracking keep all stakeholders aligned and operations transparent.
  • Enhanced Authorization & Control: Robust authorization and workflow management ensure sensitive data is secure and supplier engagement is auditable.
  • Specification Comparison & Decision Support: Users can easily compare specifications—even across multiple suppliers—supporting informed, up-to-date decisions.
  • Efficient Document & Workflow Management: Automated notifications and document summarization reduce manual effort and speed up approvals.
  • Supplier Management Integration & Traceability: The integration with supplier management in SAP Cloud ERP Private enables efficient, traceable exchanges and supports collaboration with multiple suppliers at once.

So What’s New in Specification Management?

SAP IPD’s enhanced specification management centralizes all product data, creating a true single source of truth. Our latest key innovations include

  • Dynamic Property Tree Visualization: Organize properties visually, assign them to specification types, and support multilingual definitions and inheritance templates for efficient data management.
  • AI-Enabled Search & Comparison: Prompt-based AI search and advanced comparison tools (including composition comparison) make finding and analyzing specifications faster and more intuitive.
  • Integrated Status Management: Define and manage lifecycle statuses for each specification type, with clear actions and descriptions.
  • Sustainability & Compliance: All relevant parameters are stored alongside product data, simplifying reporting and downstream processes.
  • Multiple Validity Dimensions: Manage different versions and regional variations of specifications seamlessly.
  • Workflow Integration: Trigger predefined or automatic processes, such as approval workflows, based on status changes.

And why do our Customers Choose SAP IPD for Collaboration?

Customers are turning to SAP IPD to streamline specification sharing and control access, accelerate compliance, enable OEMs to share critical data with suppliers in a controlled, auditable way, and to allow suppliers to easily access, respond to, and trace specifications, supporting rapid and accurate product development.

Driving Sustainability Goals

Sustainability is a top priority for many organizations. SAP IPD Specification Management helps customers achieve their goals by requiring suppliers to provide compliance certificates, ensuring products meet regulatory and company standards. The system analyzes sustainability data—like carbon footprint—during specification comparisons, enabling informed, environmentally conscious decisions. Detailed property trees and compositional tables help maintain quality and transparency throughout the supply chain. By embedding sustainability checks and data analysis into supplier collaboration, the solution promotes responsible sourcing and continuous improvement toward sustainability goals.

The Role of Artificial Intelligence

AI is transforming product development by streamlining ideation, documentation, and navigation. In SAP IPD, AI simplifies product specification search makes it easier for users—especially in industries impacted by complex regulations like tariffs—to find relevant information. Instead of navigating complicated field names and parameters, users can search using natural language, allowing the system to quickly filter and present the needed specifications. This intuitive approach improves accuracy, reduces the need for deep technical knowledge, and enhances the experience for both new and occasional users. Additionally, SAP’s AI assistant Joule further streamlines data discovery and boosts creativity within Specification Management.

So What’s Coming up on the Roadmap?

Looking ahead to 2026, I would like to point out two items on our roadmap : The integration with SAP Cloud ERP Private EHS Specifications for hybrid scenarios:

  • Use expanded AI capabilities like natural language document search, advanced document summaries, and collaboration search.

  • A deeper integration with the SAP Cloud ERP Private Change Management process

 

So as you can see, SAP IPD’s Specification Management is optimizing supply chains with enhanced collaboration and AI-powered features. With a strong roadmap and a commitment to sustainability, we want you to succeed in today’s rapidly changing markets.

Want to learn more?

Tune into our recent Expert Talk with SAP Product Expert Felix Reichle who talked about the latest news in Specification Management and gave an outlook on what’s coming next: Specification Management in SAP Integrated Product Development.

Don’t hesitate to leave a comment and check out our community page to ask your questions and engage with the experts. Follow the PSCC_Enablement tag to stay up to date with our latest blog posts. 

Follow me on LinkedIn and stay up-to-date with our latest enablement assets: linkedin.com/in/annette-garcia-lorenzo
